dt: {bc}to place in a specified position or relationship {bc}{sx|lay||}
{bc}to send (something, such as a weapon or missile) into or through something {bc}{sx|thrust||}
{bc}to throw with an overhand pushing motion
{bc}to bring into a specified state or condition

dt.t: a reapportionment … that was {wi}put{/wi} into effect at the September primaries

dt: {bc}to cause to endure or suffer something {bc}{sx|subject||}
{bc}to set before one for judgment or decision
{bc}to call for a formal vote on

dt.t: want to {wi}put{/wi} my feelings into words

dt: {bc}to translate into another language or style
{bc}to devote (oneself) to an activity or end

dt.t: {wi}put{/wi} himself to winning back their confidence
{wi}puts{/wi} a high value on their friendship

dt: {bc}to produce or send out by growth

dt.t: {it}put his finger on{/it} the cause of the trouble

dros.drp: put one's foot in one's mouth

dt: {bc}to make a tactless or embarrassing blunder
{bc}to make the final preparations for printing (something, such as a newspaper)

et: Middle English {it}putten{/it}; akin to Old English {it}putung{/it} instigation, Middle Dutch {it}poten{/it} to plant
shortdef: to place in a specified position or relationship : lay
to move in a specified direction
to send (something, such as a weapon or missile) into or through something : thrust

stems: i wouldn't put it past someone

dt: used to say that one would not be surprised if someone did something bad

dt.t: {it}I wouldn't put it past{/it} him to lie.

shortdef: —used to say that one would not be surprised if someone did something bad

meta.id: not to put too fine a point on it
stems: not to put too fine a point on it

hwi.hw: not to put too fine a point on it

dt: used in an ironic way to introduce a very strong and usually critical statement

dt.t: {it}Not to put too fine a point on it{/it}, (but) his suggestions have been worthless.

shortdef: —used in an ironic way to introduce a very strong and usually critical statement

dt: used as a rude way to tell someone to stop talking and especially to stop complaining

dt.t: Why don't you {it}put a cork in it{/it}! I'm sick of your whining!

shortdef: —used as a rude way to tell someone to stop talking and especially to stop complaining

dt: {bc}to stop (something) from growing or becoming worse

dt.t: These changes are intended to {it}put a lid on{/it} rising medical costs.
He angrily told them to {it}put a lid on{/it} their complaints.
I'm tired of listening to your complaints, so just {phrase}put a lid on it{/phrase}!

dt: {bc}to cause the end or failure of (something)

dt.t: The government used the army to {it}put a lid on{/it} the rebellion.

shortdef: to stop (something) from growing or becoming worse
to cause the end or failure of (something)

dt: used to tell someone to stop talking

dt.t: I wish someone would tell him to {it}put a sock in it{/it}.

shortdef: —used to tell someone to stop talking

dt.t: They {it}put it about{/it} that he was resigning.

shortdef: to tell many people about something

dt: used to invite someone to shake hands

shortdef: —used to invite someone to shake hands

dt: {bc}to say something that causes someone to be embarrassed, upset, or hurt especially when the speaker did not expect that reaction

dt.t: I really {it}put my foot in it{/it} when I asked her about her job. I didn't know she had just been fired.

shortdef: to say something that causes someone to be embarrassed, upset, or hurt especially when the speaker did not expect that reaction

meta.id: put/stick that in your pipe and smoke it
stems: put that in your pipe and smoke it
put/stick that in your pipe and smoke it
stick that in your pipe and smoke it

hwi.hw: put/stick that in your pipe and smoke it

dt: used to tell someone that he or she must accept what one says is true even though he or she might not like it or agree with it

dt.t: "It's a stupid movie." "Oh really? Well it was just nominated for an Oscar, so {it}put/stick that in your pipe and smoke it{/it}!"

shortdef: —used to tell someone that he or she must accept what one says is true even though he or she might not like it or agree with it
